thread.title: 'The Leftovers,' 'Quantico' and the death of the multi-cam sitcom | TV Hangover (PODCAST)
thread.title_full: 'The Leftovers,' 'Quantico' and the death of the multi-cam sitcom | TV Hangover (PODCAST) | NJ.com

author: Vicki Hyman | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: 'The Leftovers,' 'Quantico' and the death of the multi-cam sitcom | TV Hangover (PODCAST)
text:
No television show is left untuned in this week's edition of TV Hangover , in which TV critic Vicki Hyman and TV super fan Erin Medley tangle over the delights (Vicki) or shortfalls (Erin) of ABC's "Quantico," one of the early breakouts of the fall season, puzzle over the opening moments of HBO's "The Leftovers," which returned for a second season on Sunday, and discuss the status of broadcast sitcoms (dire, they both agree, if "Dr. Ken" is the best ABC has to offer).
You can also listen in on Vicki's interview with Elizabeth's own Manny Cabo , the 45-year-old pop rocker who heads to "The Voice" battle rounds, which begin on Monday, and learn which vintage TV and film properties are being taken out of mothballs for possible reboots. (Hint: Richard Dean Anderson fans can rejoice.)
Subscribe to the podcast on iTunes or Stitcher for our unvarnished takes on on new and returning shows, our reactions to breaking news and plenty of TV-related tangents.
If you like what you hear, rate us on iTunes , leave a comment below about what we've discussed or what you'd like to hear, or tweet us @VickiHy , @E_Meds and @TVHangoverShow .
